result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody A Simonette

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Cody A Simonette
Current: W10780 Sandcreek Court, Merrillan, WI 54754 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2022)
Prior: 201 E Main Street, Alma Center, WI 54611
CS called and provided a new address. Updated.

10:30 AM Defendant Cody A Simonette in court.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Cody A Simonette. Stipulation filed in error. Defense now wanting post plea diversion agreement. State in compliance with victim rights.  Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 2. Count 1 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea. Finding of guilt withheld. Court reviewed the proposed diversion agreement with the defendant. He understands and the requirement contained therein. Court approved the agreement.

Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
